channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Watch live: Government secures another two Covid-19 vaccines
item.description: The government has secured another two vaccines, enough for every New Zealander and its Pacific partners, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says.

item.title: Pitter Patter Education Centre in Feilding under investigation after raft of allegations
item.description: Parents and former teachers claim the owner and manager of a childcare centre in Feilding locked toddlers in rooms, fed children mouldy food and smacked them.

item.title: America's Cup backers forced to bide their time as racing begins
item.description: At least five wealthy backers of the challenger teams to the America's Cup are struggling to enter the country in time to watch their yachts race.

item.title: Police launch homicide inquiry after woman dies in Hamilton house
item.description: Officers were called to a Hamilton house where they found a seriously injured 30-year-old woman, who died at the scene a short time later.

item.title: Roast Busters arrests welcomed by anti-sexual violence campaigners
item.description: Two women who took action after the Roast Busters case came to light are welcoming arrests made yesterday, and a criminologist hopes there's a shift away from victim blaming.

item.title: Ngāi Tahu wants Rio Tinto to engage with iwi over Tiwai Point closures
item.description: Ngāi Tahu has written to Rio Tinto, seeking to "open a dialogue" over the impact the closure of the aluminium smelter will have on the community and the environment.

item.title: Auckland City Mission's new Christmas hand-out scheme aims to return dignity to those in need
item.description: Auckland City Mission is taking a new approach to handing out tens of thousands of presents and food parcels to whānau before Christmas.

item.title: Watch: Orangutans play on new grounds at Auckland Zoo
item.description: A high canopy habitat had officially opened today as part of Auckland Zoo's ongoing South East Asia Jungle Track development.

item.title: Two men previously from 'Roast Busters' arrested and charged - police
item.description: Two 24-year-old men formerly involved in the so-called Roast Busters gang have been arrested, police say.

item.title: Watch: Lorde talks about her journey to Antarctica
item.description: Aotearoa's biggest pop star, Lorde, discusses her 2019 trip to Antarctica - the culmination of her lifelong dream.

item.title: New Zealand wins right to host 2024 World Choir Games
item.description: It's the first time the event will be held in the Oceania region.

item.title: Record-breaking Christmas for NZ Post after online shopping frenzy
item.description: New Zealand Post workers are in the thick of a record-breaking Christmas amid a nationwide online shopping frenzy.

item.title: Cafe 'staffed up' as excitement builds on eve of America's Cup start
item.description: Fleets of spectator boats are expected on the water to watch the America's Cup races from tomorrow, and boaties are being asked to obey the rules.

item.title: Kekerengu crash: 'It's the suddenness of it'
item.description: A blessing has been held this afternoon at the site of yesterday's fatal helicopter crash near Kaikōura that killed a Christchurch couple and seriously injured three children.

item.title: As many as 400,000 abused in state, faith care - survivors' group
item.description: A group representing some survivors of abuse claims the estimated number of people abused while in care is well off the mark.

item.title: Latest police raids bag class-A drugs, guns and hundreds of thousands in cash
item.description: Police have seized meth, LSD, heroin, cocaine, MDMA, high-powered guns and a few hundred thousand dollars in cash following a lengthy investigation.

item.title: Veterinary staffing shortage puts animal welfare at risk
item.description: There are concerns veterinarians around the country are nearing breaking point as the industry faces major staffing shortages.

item.title: Te Arawa River Iwi Trust chair faces fraud charges
item.description: Te Arawa River Iwi Trust chair Roger Pikia is facing fraud charges brought forward by the Serious Fraud Office.
